name: quantum-espresso

conflicts.name: build_system=generic
conflicts.description: quantum-espresso: Only CMake supported for GPU-enabled version

conflicts.name: %nvhpc@21.11:22.3
conflicts.description: quantum-espresso: bugs with NVHPCSDK from v21.11 to v22.3, OpenMP and GPU
quantum-espresso: +elpa requires QE >= 6.0
quantum-espresso: +fox variant requires QE >= 7.2

conflicts.name: hdf5=parallel
conflicts.description: quantum-espresso: parallel HDF5 support only in QE 6.1.0 and later

conflicts.name: hdf5=serial
conflicts.description: quantum-espresso: serial HDF5 support only in QE 6.4.1 and later

conflicts.name: hdf5=parallel
conflicts.description: quantum-espresso: parallel HDF5 requires MPI support

conflicts.name: @6.4+patch
conflicts.description: quantum-espresso: QE-to-QMCPACK wave function converter requires deactivatation of upstream patches

conflicts.name: @6.3:6.4.0 hdf5=serial
conflicts.description: quantum-espresso: QE-to-QMCPACK wave function converter only supported with parallel HDF5

conflicts.name: @:7.0 hdf5=none
conflicts.description: quantum-espresso: QE-to-QMCPACK wave function converter requires HDF5
quantum-espresso: QMCPACK converter NOT available for this version of QE

conflicts.name: build_system=generic
conflicts.description: quantum-espresso: QE-to-QMCPACK wave function converter requires cmake

conflicts.name: ~epw
conflicts.description: quantum-espresso: epw cannot be turned off when using CMake
quantum-espresso: EPW only available from version 6.0.0 and on

conflicts.name: ^openmpi@2.0.0:2
conflicts.description: quantum-espresso: OpenMPI version incompatible with EPW

conflicts.name: ^openmpi@1.10.7%pgi@17.0:17.12
conflicts.description: quantum-espresso: PGI+OpenMPI version combo incompatible with EPW

conflicts.name: ~mpi
conflicts.description: quantum-espresso: EPW needs MPI when build_system=generic
quantum-espresso: gipaw standard support available for QE 6.3 or greater version only

conflicts.name: ~fox
conflicts.description: quantum-espresso: gipaw plugin requires FoX

conflicts.name: build_system=generic
conflicts.description: quantum-espresso: Please use CMake to build with AOCC

conflicts.name: ~openmp
conflicts.description: quantum-espresso: amdlibflame requires OpenMP
quantum-espresso: Internal compiler error with gcc8 and a64fx
quantum-espresso: 6.4.x is the latest QE series supported by Environ

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: generator
variants.description: the build system generator to use

variants.name: patch
variants.description: Apply recommended upstream patches. May need to be set to False for third party patches or plugins

variants.name: elpa
variants.description: Uses elpa as an eigenvalue solver

variants.name: hdf5
variants.description: Orbital and density data I/O with HDF5

variants.name: environ
variants.description: Enables support for introducing environment effects into atomistic first-principles simulations.See http://quantum-environ.org/about.html

description:
Quantum ESPRESSO is an integrated suite of Open-Source computer codes
for electronic-structure calculations and materials modeling at the
nanoscale. It is based on density-functional theory, plane waves, and
pseudopotentials.

dependencies.name: acfl
dependencies.description:
Arm Compiler combines the optimized tools and libraries from Arm with a
modern LLVM-based compiler framework.

dependencies.name: amdblis
dependencies.description:
AMD Optimized BLIS. BLIS is a portable software framework for
instantiating high-performance BLAS-like dense linear algebra libraries.
The framework was designed to isolate essential kernels of computation
that, when optimized, immediately enable optimized implementations of
most of its commonly used and computationally intensive operations.
LICENSING INFORMATION: By downloading, installing and using this
software, you agree to the terms and conditions of the AMD AOCL-BLIS
license agreement. You may obtain a copy of this license agreement from
https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocl/dense/eula/blas-4-1-eula.html
https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocl/dense/eula/blas-eula.html

dependencies.name: amdfftw
dependencies.description:
FFTW (AMD Optimized version) is a comprehensive collection of fast C
routines for computing the Discrete Fourier Transform (DFT) and various
special cases thereof. It is an open-source implementation of the Fast
Fourier transform algorithm. It can compute transforms of real and
complex-values arrays of arbitrary size and dimension. AMD Optimized
FFTW is the optimized FFTW implementation targeted for AMD CPUs. For
single precision build, please use precision value as float. Example :
spack install amdfftw precision=float LICENSING INFORMATION: By
downloading, installing and using this software, you agree to the terms
and conditions of the AMD AOCL-FFTW license agreement. You may obtain a
copy of this license agreement from
https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocl/fftw/eula/fftw-
libraries-4-1-eula.html
https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocl/fftw/eula/fftw-libraries-eula.html

dependencies.name: armpl-gcc
dependencies.description:
Arm Performance Libraries provides optimized standard core math
libraries for high-performance computing applications on Arm processors.

dependencies.name: blas
dependencies.description:
LAPACK version 3.X is a comprehensive FORTRAN library that does linear
algebra operations including matrix inversions, least squared solutions
to linear sets of equations, eigenvector analysis, singular value
decomposition, etc. It is a very comprehensive and reputable package
that has found extensive use in the scientific community.

dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: cuda
dependencies.description:
CUDA is a parallel computing platform and programming model invented by
NVIDIA. It enables dramatic increases in computing performance by
harnessing the power of the graphics processing unit (GPU). Note: This
package does not currently install the drivers necessary to run CUDA.
These will need to be installed manually. See:
https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/ for details.

dependencies.name: elpa
dependencies.description: Eigenvalue solvers for Petaflop-Applications (ELPA)

dependencies.name: fftw
dependencies.description:
FFTW is a C subroutine library for computing the discrete Fourier
transform (DFT) in one or more dimensions, of arbitrary input size, and
of both real and complex data (as well as of even/odd data, i.e. the
discrete cosine/sine transforms or DCT/DST). We believe that FFTW, which
is free software, should become the FFT library of choice for most
applications.

dependencies.name: fftw-api
dependencies.description:
FFTW (AMD Optimized version) is a comprehensive collection of fast C
routines for computing the Discrete Fourier Transform (DFT) and various
special cases thereof. It is an open-source implementation of the Fast
Fourier transform algorithm. It can compute transforms of real and
complex-values arrays of arbitrary size and dimension. AMD Optimized
FFTW is the optimized FFTW implementation targeted for AMD CPUs. For
single precision build, please use precision value as float. Example :
spack install amdfftw precision=float LICENSING INFORMATION: By
downloading, installing and using this software, you agree to the terms
and conditions of the AMD AOCL-FFTW license agreement. You may obtain a
copy of this license agreement from
https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocl/fftw/eula/fftw-
libraries-4-1-eula.html
https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocl/fftw/eula/fftw-libraries-eula.html

dependencies.name: git
dependencies.description:
Git is a free and open source distributed version control system
designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with
speed and efficiency.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: hdf5
dependencies.description:
HDF5 is a data model, library, and file format for storing and managing
data. It supports an unlimited variety of datatypes, and is designed for
flexible and efficient I/O and for high volume and complex data.

dependencies.name: intel-mkl
dependencies.description:
Intel Math Kernel Library. This package has been replaced by intel-
oneapi-mkl. LICENSE INFORMATION: By downloading and using this software,
you agree to the terms and conditions of the software license agreements
at https://intel.ly/393CijO.

dependencies.name: lapack
dependencies.description:
LAPACK version 3.X is a comprehensive FORTRAN library that does linear
algebra operations including matrix inversions, least squared solutions
to linear sets of equations, eigenvector analysis, singular value
decomposition, etc. It is a very comprehensive and reputable package
that has found extensive use in the scientific community.

dependencies.name: libxc
dependencies.description:
Libxc is a library of exchange-correlation functionals for density-
functional theory.

dependencies.name: m4
dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.

dependencies.name: mpi
dependencies.description: MSMPI is a Windows port of MPICH provided by the Windows team

dependencies.name: ninja
dependencies.description:
Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from
other build systems in two major respects: it is designed to have its
input files generated by a higher-level build system, and it is designed
to run builds as fast as possible.

dependencies.name: openblas
dependencies.description: OpenBLAS: An optimized BLAS library

dependencies.name: scalapack
dependencies.description:
The Cray Scientific Libraries package, LibSci, is a collection of
numerical routines optimized for best performance on Cray systems.
